target_audience.primary_persona: Crypto traders on rugs.fun who want automated trading bots and game replay analysis
secondary_personas: Data scientists analyzing trading patterns and market behavior
pain_points: No way to capture and replay trading sessions for analysis
Local calculations often conflict with server state in live trading
Difficulty collecting high-quality training data for RL models
Lack of semantic search across trading event history
Manual trading is error-prone and slow compared to bots
goals: Record and replay trading sessions with full event fidelity
Train RL models on historical trading data
Execute trades automatically via bot with human-like timing
Analyze trading patterns using semantic search and RAG
Monitor live game sessions with server-authoritative state
target_audience.usage_context: Desktop application for monitoring rugs.fun crypto trading games, capturing WebSocket events for ML training, and running automated trading bots in various execution modes

product_vision.one_liner: Unified game replay and live trading platform with DuckDB/Parquet storage and VectorDB semantic search for rugs.fun
product_vision.problem_statement: Crypto traders on rugs.fun lack tools to capture trading sessions, replay them for analysis, and train automated trading bots. Manual trading is slow and inconsistent, while local state calculations conflict with server state.
product_vision.value_proposition: VECTRA-PLAYER provides canonical truth storage in Parquet files, server-authoritative state management, multiple execution modes (recording, training, validation, live), and RAG-powered semantic search - enabling traders to build, train, and deploy sophisticated trading bots
success_metrics: 100% event capture fidelity with latency tracking
RL model training accuracy on captured data
Sub-second trade execution in live mode
Zero data loss during live trading sessions

existing_features: EventStore - single writer Parquet persistence with DuckDB queries
HumanActionInterceptor - capture human trades with full context
MinimalWindow UI for RL training data collection
CDP browser automation via rugs_bot Chrome profile
ChromaDB integration for semantic search via claude-flow
Comprehensive CI/CD with 9 GitHub Actions workflows
known_gaps: Shorting integration deferred (no protocol data captured)
technical_debt: Legacy recorders being removed (demo_recorder, recorder_sink, unified_recorder)
Ruff linting rules temporarily ignored (B904, N806, N803, etc.)
Some os.path usage instead of pathlib
Inherited naming conventions from REPLAYER fork

alternatives: Manual trading on rugs.fun web interface
Generic crypto trading bots (not rugs.fun specific)
Custom Python scripts for WebSocket monitoring
differentiators: Purpose-built for rugs.fun protocol with deep WebSocket understanding
Canonical Parquet storage with DuckDB analytical queries
Four execution modes for complete bot development lifecycle
RAG integration enables natural language queries over trading history
competitive_context.market_position: Specialized trading platform and bot development toolkit for the rugs.fun ecosystem, combining data engineering (Parquet/DuckDB), ML infrastructure (RL training modes), and automation (CDP browser control) in a single integrated solution

technical: Chrome with CDP required for browser automation
Phantom wallet extension must be pre-configured in rugs_bot profile
External ChromaDB infrastructure in claude-flow project
dependencies: rugs-rl-bot project for RL training integration
Chrome DevTools Protocol for browser automation
